statement.p: In 40 of the last 30 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{30}}={0.4}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{30}. \displaystyle{P}={0.4}\cdot{30}={12}. This is the number of days that it rained. We want the non-rainy days which is 30-12=18 We round that as requested to 18.
